item.title: Report E-2024100246
item.description:
Report E-2024100246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-14
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0316 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSL it was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Weld On #4 Clear was released from two 1-gallon metal pails due to improper loading by terminal XKC. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 29. The product has evaporated so no absorbents were needed. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report X-2024061876
item.description:
Report X-2024061876

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T00:58:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 4 plastic bottles @ 4 L each. One inner bottle leaked from what appeared to be a puncture. Employee performing spill clean-up used PPE including a respirator due to the strong odor. Several employees complained of itchy burning throats, one employee complained of respiratory problems. The employee with respiratory problems went to the clinic the following day but was not admitted to the hospital. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.
